added content to introduce the topic rather than jumping right in with today's issues minus context
moved second paragraph down as it is about politics/activism not description
added 'men' here to show that this is not class or race or other equality
rewrote tortured second sentence to make it complete, general and flow with the PP

/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ rv POV, unsourced rant
/* Feminism and science */ question who so-called 'anti-feminists' are here
Removing "centers around" and misc. cleanup using [[Wikipedia:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
"some strands of feminism" is correct, not that many strands of feminism have the idea of patriarchy central to it
only capitalize the first letter and any proper nouns in a header, please; not all feminists/feminisms support the idea of patriarchy
cleaning and some NPOVing, some of these points need direct citation
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/64.12.116.132|64.12.116.132]] ([[User talk:64.12.116.132|talk]]) to last version by DougBaker
/* Critical of feminism or of specific types of feminism */
/* Critical of feminism or of specific types of feminism */
/* Critical of feminism or of specific types of feminism */
/* See also */ Trimming some topics that don't seem really central to feminism. There's already a [[List of feminism topics]] and this article is bloated.
/* See also */ rm link to deleted article
/* Feminism and science */ left out a word
/* Feminism and science */ minor wording improvements
/* Critical of feminism or of specific types of feminism */
restored links that were removed without explanation
/* Critical of feminism or of specific types of feminism */
deleted statement that was so general and vague as to be meaningless here.
Deleted because there is no single 'gender'-focused feminism called IT. please see discussion article
edited to include the realities that are being reported worldwide in the mass media please see discussion article as source.
/* Feminism and science */tried to take the politics out of the science section in all content please see discussion
/* Feminism and science */ saying 'feminist'-scientist is like saying feminist-physicist which is absurd because physics has nothing to do with feminism or vice versa.
/* Feminism and science */ There are no 'anti-feminist's in genuine science. What scientists made these arguments. Science is supposed to be about open inquiry not politics, I changed tone to match
/* Feminism and science */ I am going to try to eliminate the word criticism here, please see discussion, I hope to see science that backs feminism here to.
/* Feminism and science */ clarify that it's the arguments that *cite* scientific theories that are antifeminist, not necessarily the theories
/* Feminism and science */ deleted 'anti-feminist' as authentic science is a search for truth, not feminist or anti-feminist
/* Feminism and science */ Make it more clear what feminist scientists are criticizing.
restoring nuance, without problematic terms like "gender feminism"
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ added a new criticism that is reflected in many mass media sources
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ deleted 4-5 long counter-criticism to uncover two short criticisms please see discussion.
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ deleted 4 long tortured counter criticisms to uncover two criticisms, please see discussion
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ changed 'anti-feminists' to 'some people' as anti-feminists are unidentified.
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ Separated Islam as not Paleoconservative:please expand. Left possible counter criticism because in doubt.
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ deleted qualification that I doubt THEY note and seems counter-critical, please see discussion.
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ deleted counter criticisms of criticisms, as this belongs in another section, please see discussion
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ added content based on HHS child abuse summary in child abuse article.
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ deleted counter criticism of criticism, see discussion.
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ put parethesis around feminist statement to show this is a 'masculist' PP
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ tried to show who?? has these concerns as it was left hanging here.
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ deleted counter-criticism as irrelevant to section, see discussion
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ changed 'organizations' to ideologies for precision here and to match content
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ added 'seen as' because 'gender' oppression is second wave POV not fact.
/* Feminism and science */ added attachment of 'power vs sex' as a feminist idea/Brownmiller '75
/* Feminism and science */ edit Ghiglieri statement to focus on rape only.
/* Books */ rm Kathy Fray book - nn, unreferenced in the article
/* Feminism and science */ minor edit to be precise and avoid implication of feminist 'steoreotypes' here.
added 'opposing' here to reflect realities mentioned in many news articles (gender vs equity ideologies)
rv references to non-notable book and concept
/* Books */ rm reference to book not cited in article
/* See also */ doesn't really seem to be a particularly notable or established form of feminism
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/152.163.100.8|152.163.100.8]] ([[User talk:152.163.100.8|talk]]) to last version by 214.13.194.178
/* Effect on heterosexual relationships */ I only see an old discussion, and no new contributions to that at the talk page on this section, so why is it here???
/* Effect on heterosexual relationships */ wrong tag
/* Critical of feminism or of specific types of feminism */
See Talk page on "gender feminism." All forms of feminism, including what CHS identifies as "equity feminism," are concerned with sex inequality; they differ how to analyze and combat it.
maybe so, but this needs to be sourced rather than blandly stated as fact in the editorial voice
/* Feminism in many forms */ several edits. See Talk on "Gender feminism." The claim that radical feminism has primarily exercised influence in the academy is unsourced, and I think probably untrue.
/* Feminism and science */ tightened this sentence for clarity
/* Feminism and science */ added feminist here to make relevant to this article and to represent the books content with quotes from bell hooks and others.
made distinctions between other competing forms of feminism to dispel false one form is ALL POV.
added another distinction here will be glad to discuss but no cute stuff like removing already existing gender feminism links please.
There is a lot of POV going on to attach ALL forms of feminism as the one described earlier in this opening
/* Feminism and science */ seems like we are back to gender again here. please be specific
/* Feminism and science */ I read this book. This is as close to NPOV as I can get and honor the book. Please check your POV about my POV.
/* Feminism and science */ corrected false statement, you are POV pushing here too. This entire paragraph is tightly focused on gender so please leave it alone
rv spam (user has added references to this book, and other Sobel books, to hundreds of articles)
/* Feminism and science */ again, let's try to not make the entire article revolved around this "good feminism (according to ifeminists)/bad feminism" distinction -- that's POV
added distinctions to respond to POV problems see discussion.
added content to reflect the realities I see in both old, status quo and new literature by feminists. Please discuss before reverts.
/* Feminism and science */ added content that is not critical but investigative. is this section intended to be critical or NPOV investigative.
/* Feminism and science */ added distinction to distinguish between 'gender' and 'choice' focused feminism
rm feminism=bigotry; may be true but smacks of bias
/* Critical of feminism or specific types of feminism */
/* Critical of feminism */ added distinction here as feminism is NO monolythic one-size- fits all ideology. please discuss before reverts
added other types of feminism which are less significant here. Please see Wendy Mcelroy's distinctions.
clarified 'gender' type versus one HOMOGENOUS feminism. Please make distinctions that include other types here too such as individualist etc.
/* Supportive of feminism */ moved new link to bottom as per precedent

New section on feminism and science - it could use expansion
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ avoid use of "gender feminism", since it's not a widely known term
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ changed content to reflect feminists like Wendy McElroy or Camille Paglia.
/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ added content and distinctions to section intro, so feminism and criticism is seen as multifacited rather than monolythic.
/* Critical of feminism */ added distinction to title to reflect links' content

/* Contemporary criticisms of feminism */ deleted statements using science to argue FOR feminism that belong in some other section as this one is tittled Criticisms against feminism

rv, this concern is addressed later in the article
rv., equalitarianism seems to be synonymous with egalitarian, adds nothing
